page.title: 03Winster crafts
page.content: At an isolated house called Stonehills at the east end of Green Lane, the art of wood carving has been developed and also music taught by the owners. At Springfield near Winster post office pottery birds are made for sale. Mr Sefton at the east end of Green Lane makes harpsichords, and also takes pupils to learn how to play one. At Wilds Farm near the Winster main guide post the son of Wild does metal work and acts as village and area blacksmith. Evidence of his work is seen in the beautiful gates and place names in the whole valley.
